etymology.description: 阴(yīn, hidden; feminine) + 道(dào, path/channel) = vaginal canal.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the yin/hidden or feminine sense of 阴 with 道 ‘path/channel’ to denote the internal genital passage. Emphasizes an inner channel associated with the yin aspect.
etymology.simplification: 陰 → 阴 by simplifying the right-side phonetic component to reduce strokes; 道 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 医生解释了阴道的结构(醫生解釋了陰道的結構)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiěshì le yīndào de jiégòu.
examples.english: The doctor explained the structure of the vagina.

examples.chinese: 这本教材讨论了阴道健康与护理(這本教材討論了陰道健康與護理)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn jiàocái tǎolùn le yīndào jiànkāng yǔ hùlǐ.
examples.english: This textbook discusses vaginal health and care.

examples.chinese: 在生物课上，老师讲解阴道在生殖系统中的作用(在生物課上，老師講解陰道在生殖系統中的作用)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shēngwù kè shàng, lǎoshī jiǎngjiě yīndào zài shēngzhí xìtǒng zhōng de zuòyòng.
examples.english: In biology class, the teacher explained the role of the vagina in the reproductive system.
